catList: This course aims to provide the participants of of energy technologies and management master program three major topics; (1) Scientific research and reporting methods, (2)Knowledge sharing, collaboration and team working, (3) Fundamental technical terms and knowledge about energy.

This course aims to provide the participants of energy technologies and management master program three major topics; (1) Scientific research and reporting methods (Designing a research outline, formulating a research question and sub-questions, literature review - accessing to online research databases and library resources, understanding the definitions and importance of primary and secondary data, understanding the qualitative (case studies, content analysis, in-depth interviews, participant and non-participant observations etc.) and quantitative (surveys- questionnaires, statistical methods) research methods and selecting the most suitable research method for a particular research, analyzing qualitative and quantitative results),(2) Knowledge sharing, collaboration and team working, (3) Fundamental technical terms and knowledge about energy.

Key technical terms and concepts in energy. Research and reporting methods; research design. Defining research objective and research questions. Qualitative and quantitative research methods. Analysis of data. Giving references and preventing plagiarism. Learning and experiencing methods for knowledge sharing, collaboration and teamwork. Written and oral presentation of research.
